bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 8, 1937

div1.p: Hutchison writes to Hench about postponing the ceremonies to honor Lazear until commencement.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 8, 1937

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
March 8, 1937

div1.p:
Just a hasty note as I am leaving for
a day's program in Pittsburgh. Your thoughts and
mine on Lord Dawson are “synonymous.” I have already
written to Lord Dawson to ask him whether he would
not come in June of 1938 for this same program. The
date would be more suitable than the one first
suggested for several reasons. It would give him
more time to prepare. Our students would be more
likely to put on a good presentation of “Yellow Jack.”
Nineteen thirty eight would, I think, be the fiftieth
anniversary of the graduation of Lazear who was, I
believe, of the Class of '88. His class would be
having their fiftieth reunion and receiving their
fifty-year diplomas. It would be ideal.

The Kessinger information is grand, and
whoever he is or whatever he is, he could be greatly
featured. I must look it up in the story of “Yellow
Jack” and see whether he is given a part. If he
has not we will have the author revise it and put him
in.

I am glad you are having such a delightful
time and I wish that we might be with you. Give our
love to Mary.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Dr. P. S. Hench
Hotel Villa Atlantique
Palm Beach, Florida
